title: Can Not Build with CCE on Shasta

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
My team has little experience with Spack and about the same with our new Shasta system.  While I know Shasta's new (our is one the first), I'm concerned that I must be missing "something" fundamental in how I should be configuring my compiler, etc as I can't even do a base build of zlib with cce.  
```console
$ spack install zlib %cce
==> Installing zlib
==> No binary for zlib found: installing from source
==> zlib: Executing phase: 'install'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    './configure' '--prefix=/apps/spack/spack-0.15.4/opt/spack/cray-sles15-zen2/cce-10.0.1/zlib-1.2.11-y3flhbrdjyke55y3dgm6f2iiepfj2rds'
See build log for details:
  /tmp/hpc-adm/spack-stage/spack-stage-zlib-1.2.11-y3flhbrdjyke55y3dgm6f2iiepfj2rds/spack-build-out.txt

hpc-adm@ln02-nmn:/apps/spack/spack-0.15.4/opt/spack/cray-sles15-zen2> cat /tmp/hpc-adm/spack-stage/spack-stage-zlib-1.2.11-y3flhbrdjyke55y3dgm6f2iiepfj2rds/spack-build-out.txt
==> zlib: Executing phase: 'install'
==> [2020-08-28-13:34:30.205627] './configure' '--prefix=/apps/spack/spack-0.15.4/opt/spack/cray-sles15-zen2/cce-10.0.1/zlib-1.2.11-y3flhbrdjyke55y3dgm6f2iiepfj2rds'
Compiler error reporting is too harsh for ./configure (perhaps remove -Werror).
** ./configure aborting.
```
### Steps to reproduce the issue

On Shasta system.... 
- extract Spack
- run setup_env.sh
- spack install zlib %cce

### Error Message

The build log shows the following error:
```
Compiler error reporting is too harsh for ./configure (perhaps remove -Werror).
** ./configure aborting.
```

### Information on your system
 spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.15.4
* **Python:** 3.6.10
* **Platform:** cray-sles15-zen2

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

<!-- We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively!

If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.

Other than that, thanks for taking the time to contribute to Spack! -->
